vulnerabilities.title: Ghost vulnerable to XSS via malicious Portal preview links
vulnerabilities.description:
### Impact
An attacker was able to craft a malicious link that, when accessed by an authenticated staff user or member, would execute JavaScript with the victim's permissions, potentially leading to account takeover. 

### Vulnerable versions
This vulnerability is present in Ghost versions:
- v5.43.0 to v5.120.4
- v6.0.0 to v6.14.0

As well as in Portal versions:
- v2.29.1 to v2.51.4
- v2.52.0 to v2.57.0

### Patches

vulnerabilities.title: Ghost's improper authentication allows access to member information and actions
vulnerabilities.description:
### Impact

Improper authentication on some endpoints used for member actions would allow an attacker to perform member-only actions, and read member information.

### Vulnerable versions

This security vulnerability is present in Ghost v4.46.0-v5.89.5.

Ghost(Pro) customers are automatically updated to fixed versions ahead of disclosure.

If you're a self-hoster, please follow our [update instructions](https://ghost.org/docs/update).

### Patches

v5.89.5 contains a fix for this issue.
